definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: Gianna Jun puts on a brave show in her Hollywood debut.
sentences.chinese: 全智賢在她好萊塢的處女作中表現英勇。

sentences.english: The corporal was cited for bravery in battle.
sentences.chinese: 那位下士因作戰英勇而受到嘉獎。

sentences.english: Hope and courage are two bright diamonds in the crown of success.
sentences.chinese: 指望戰英勇是勝利之冕下兩顆敞亮的鑽石。

sentences.english: Our brave weavers have turned their pavement grave of their slave-owners.
sentences.chinese: 我們英勇的織工已把人行道變成了他們主人的墳墓。

sentences.english: Sure enough, belts son Bao Arrow extraordinary bravery, skelter.
sentences.chinese: 果然，配帶寶箭的兒子英勇非凡，所向披靡。

sentences.english: The soldiers knew they could not escape, so they determined to die game.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們知道他們已經無法逃走了，於是決心英勇就義。

sentences.english: Class Abilities are available to all specs in the class. All warriors learn heroic strike for example.
sentences.chinese: 全天賦可學，例如所有戰士都能學英勇打擊。

sentences.english: The beleaguered Jedi Knights fought valiantly to repulse the Mandalorian marauders.
sentences.chinese: 被圍攻的絕地武士英勇戰鬥，擊退了曼達洛強盜。

sentences.english: The year 1871 witnessed the heroic uprising of the Paris Commune.
sentences.chinese: 1871年爆發了英勇的巴黎公社起義。

sentences.english: So may God bless those brave men and women in uniform who are away from their families this holiday season.
sentences.chinese: 請上帝保佑這些在佳節之際仍遠在他鄉的英勇士兵們。

sentences.english: He brought honour to his family by his heroism.
sentences.chinese: 他以他的英勇行爲給他家帶來榮譽。

sentences.english: We should acclaim and support the heroic resistance of Feng Chih-an's troops.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該讚揚和擁護馮治安部的英勇抗戰。

sentences.english: The stone is marked with the names of all our brave soldiers who laid down their lives in the war.
sentences.chinese: 這塊碑石上刻有在戰爭中犧牲的全部英勇戰士的名字。

sentences.english: Your bravery and heroism earned you medals and recognition from the Alliance fleet.
sentences.chinese: 你的英勇善戰爲你贏得了聯盟艦隊的勳章和認可。

sentences.english: He had acted heroical ly during the liner's evacuation.
sentences.chinese: 他在班機撤退的期間表現得很英勇。

sentences.english: The town responded gallantly to the War.
sentences.chinese: 全鎮的人都英勇無畏地投入了這場戰爭。

definition: bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
to fight at the head of one's troops/(fig.) to take the lead
lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom); fig. deeply moving/happy and sad/inspiring and tragic
